extracted_data.name: Mritunjay Sharma
extracted_data.tagline: Backend Engineer with 3+ years of experience
extracted_data.bio: Backend Engineer with 3+ years of experience building scalable, real-time systems using Python frameworks (FastAPI and Django). Skilled in designing REST APIs, optimizing performance with Redis, and Celery, and deploying production-ready services using Docker and Kubernetes. Experienced in WebSockets for real-time communication and integrating LLM-powered modules into backend workflows. Strong ownership mindset with a track record of delivering end-to-end projects while collaborating effectively across teams.

experience.description: Developed and deployed backend microservices using Python frameworks including FastAPI for high-performance APIs and Django for data-driven applications, containerized with Docker and scaled on Kubernetes. Built real-time communication layers with WebSockets, enabling low-latency data streaming to dashboards and client apps. Integrated AI/LLM-powered modules into production workflows, such as automated incident alerts and intelligent reporting.

Designed and developed backend systems using Django, ensuring robust and scalable architecture for enterprise applications. Implemented and optimized database schemas and queries using PostgreSQL, improving application performance and data integrity. Built and maintained RESTful APIs to support seamless integration between frontend applications and backend services. Enhanced database operations by creating complex stored procedures, triggers, and indexing strategies in PostgreSQL.

experience.company: Young Engineers Entrepreneurship Program by IEEE
experience.description: Led development of an IoT-based Remote Healthcare Monitoring System, enabling real-time tracking of patient vital signs and health metrics. Used Arduino IDE and embedded C for sensor interfacing and microcontroller programming.

projects.name: Real-Time Video Streaming and Incident Detection Platform
projects.description: Developed a robust backend service using FastAPI to process live video feeds from multiple cameras. Integrated WebSockets to stream AI/ML inference results, such as incident detections, in real time to a client dashboard. Leveraged asyncio and concurrent workers for parallel processing of multiple camera streams, and implemented Redis + Celery for efficient background job management and scaling heavy workloads. Deployed the system using Kubernetes on Azure, ensuring high scalability and resilience. The platform also featured LLM-powered alert management to generate intelligent summaries of safety incidents and send notifications to MS Teams, delivering a production-ready solution combining real-time processing with AI-driven insights.

projects.name: Ticket Raising Application
projects.description: Designed and developed a comprehensive backend system for a ticket raising application, allowing users to efficiently create, assign, and track tickets within an organization. Implemented robust role-based authentication using Django’s built-in system to ensure secure access control. Structured a database in PostgreSQL to efficiently store and manage ticket details, assignments, and status updates. Built RESTful APIs using Django REST Framework (DRF) to handle all ticket operations, including creation, assignment, and status tracking. Incorporated advanced search and filtering functionalities, enabling users to quickly find tickets based on priority, status, and assigned personnel.
